results.title: Asian highway
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Japan Broadcasting Corporation, Ivan Chapman, Akira Taketomi and Shizuo Kimura
results.brief_description: The story of the transformation of the world’s oldest road into a modern all-weather motor highway. The ancient caravan route stretches 8,000 miles across Asia from the Iranian-Turkish border to East Pakistan. Work started in 1958 and when completed modern asphalt or concrete roads will stretch almost halfway across Asia, linking up with European highway networks. It will serve an area where more than 600 million people live. Shows the people who live along the highway, their way of life, and their emergence from seclusion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Japan Broadcasting Corporation, Ivan Chapman, Akira Taketomi and Shizuo Kimura

results.title: Asian earth
results.brief_description: Documents the activities and provlems of a Hindu peasant family of the lower Ganges Valley. They are seen at work, play, and worship during the cycle of one year. In the narration, the mother of the family presents here explanation and interpretation. (Awards: First prize at Golden Reel Festival; Cleveland; Stamford; Illinois)

results.title: Asian crescent
results.creator_credit: Lever Brothers, James Carr and Peter Hopkinson
results.brief_description: A look at some of the social and economic problems facing the Malaysian Federation. Although born in Malaysia the people may be Chinese, Indian, Malay, with different languages, religions and ways of life. The federation is determined to give equality of opportunity and a real sense of natural unity to all its people.

results.title: Asian artists in crystals
results.brief_description: Describes an exhibit of American crystalware engraved with designs created by sixteen artists representing Burma, Ceylon, China, Egypt, India, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Japan, Korea, Pakistan, the Philippines, Syria, Thailand, Turkey, and Vietnam. Shows the work of these artists, how American designers captured the mood of the drawings in crystal form, and how American craftsmen translated the drawings into engravings.
results.description: Describes an exhibit of American crystalware engraved with designs created by sixteen artists representing Burma, Ceylon, China, Egypt, India, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Japan, Korea, Pakistan, the Philippines, Syria, Thailand, Turkey, and Vietnam. results.title: Asian adventure
results.creator_credit: Grainger Maynard, Australian Television Network and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: This visually stunning documentary captures the most forbidding and exotic of Asian locations in a series of fast moving adventures. Journey through China on a month-long bicycle tour through the southern Province of Guandong, witness dragon-boat racing and the magic of Chinese National Day celebrations. In India visit the magnificent waterways and colourful houseboats of Kashmir, tour the ancient fort city of Jhodpur and travel by camel across the Great Rajasthan Desert. Witness the magnificent spectacle of the city of Jaisalmer and embark on a fascinating bike ride from the famous pink city of Jaipur to Agra and it’s breathtaking temple of love, the Taj Mahal.
